ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I improved my verbal communication as well as my grammar in this course.
I further developed my fluency and confidence in speaking and writing. I also learned skills in presenting my work through various multimedia forms such as videos, slides and infographics.
Gained grammatical skills and better fluency in spanish
Significant improvement in grammar. Noticeable change viewed by family!

I learned how to more effectively communicate in Spanish in both written and spoken form. Learning different tenses and when to use them has helped me more fluently create sentences. Her emphasis on elaboration and expansion of Spanish vocabulary helped especially in speaking academic Spanish, a spoken and written form of the language I was not accustomed to using before this class. Overall, because of Prof. Alexandrovs on communication in Spanish versus ensuring perfect usage of the language, she fostered an environment that allowed for making mistakes and growing from them, making it easier to participate in class without being nervous about making mistakes.

I really improved by ability to converse in the Spanish language. Rather than spending large sums of time relearning grammar I was already confident in, I just got to apply it to conversation and writing, skills I still need to improve upon.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: A strength of this course are the activities that we did in class which helped with our understanding of the language and practicing skills we were uncomfortable with. This course could be improved with a slightly smaller class size.
It was incredibly organized and well taught with room for questions and any feedback at any point. The instructor was receptive and responsive.

Strengths: emphasis on communication in Spanish, but also some usage of English to facilitate communications, which lessens the pressure when you dont know a word or phrase in Spanish; Prof. Alexandrov is super understanding and truly cares for her students, she will work with you so that you can succeed; 

Weakness: much work is assigned for this class, but it all correlates with course material so it does not feel like busy work, but it could be lessened some, but its doable

The strengths of this course were the diario assignments. They were incredibly helpful and also allowed me to learn much more about Mexican culture. I would say a weakness, even though it was not much of a weakness, was having to do a final project with a medium I we not familiar with. However, it was still great to learn how to do.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes I would definitely recommend this course to more students. I really enjoyed it and learned a lot.
Yes. For heritage speakers, it is an essential place to be. It definitely strengthened my cultural intelligence and affirmed my identity within this institution.
Of course since this class isnt stressful and is actually very informative for students who have Spanish and Latin American heritage
I would recommend this course to another student. Professor Alexandrov is an excellent professor who clearly cares a lot about the learning and development of her students.

I would absolutely recommend this class to any heritage speaker, especially students without any formal education in Spanish. It helps to know what we should continue doing in the language and what we can change to better our communications in Spanish.

If you are a native speaker looking to improve your reading, writing, and speaking in Spanish then yes I 100% recommend this course. This course helped me build up the confidence I needed to practice Spanish more and created an environment where I didn't feel bad making mistakes and learning from them.
